sections.title: Create a stable foundation for implants
sections.body: If bone height or width has reduced, adding graft material or lifting the sinus floor can give the implant a secure base. We recommend it only when scans show it will support long-term stability and comfort.
sections.mediaHint: CBCT-led planning and staged implant care

sections.title: Who benefits from grafting or sinus lift?
items: Missing teeth for a while with reduced bone volume
Previous gum issues that left thinner bone in the area
Upper back teeth where the sinus floor sits low
Patients choosing implants instead of removable dentures
Not everyone needs grafting — we confirm with scans and planning

sections.title: From scans to stable implant placement
items: Consultation: talk through your goals, medical history, and comfort preferences
CBCT and digital impressions: map bone levels and neighbouring structures
Planning: agree the safest sequence and share timelines and fees
Grafting or sinus lift: place graft material with measured, gentle techniques
Healing window: allow integration time with review appointments
Implant placement: guided placement once the foundation is ready
Restoration and review: fit the crown or bridge and check bite comfort

sections.title: Digital planning that reduces surprises
sections.body: We pair CBCT imaging with guided surgery principles so grafting and implant placement align. Digital impressions and lab coordination help restorations seat comfortably once healing is complete.

sections.title: Healing support and clear aftercare
items: Gentle hygiene advice to keep the graft site clean without pressure

sections.title: Questions about grafting and sinus lifts

faqs.question: Do I always need bone grafting for implants?
faqs.answer: No. We only recommend grafting when scans show there isn't enough bone to support an implant predictably.

faqs.question: What is a sinus lift?
faqs.answer: A sinus lift gently raises the sinus floor and places graft material to create enough height for an implant near upper back teeth.

faqs.question: How long does grafting take to heal?
faqs.answer: Healing times vary, but many grafts need several months before implant placement. We confirm your timeline after reviewing scans.

faqs.question: Can I have a temporary tooth while healing?
faqs.answer: In many cases we can provide a provisional solution to maintain your smile while the graft heals.

faqs.question: Does grafting hurt?
faqs.answer: Treatment is carried out with local anaesthetic and careful techniques; some soreness afterwards is normal and we support you with guidance.

faqs.question: What affects success?
faqs.answer: Factors like smoking, diabetes control, and oral hygiene can influence healing. We tailor advice to your situation and monitor progress.

faqs.question: How much does it cost?
faqs.answer: Costs depend on the type of grafting and number of implants. After assessment we share a clear plan with fees for each stage.
